radiographic_examinations.findings: The included lung bases are clear. The heart is not enlarged. The liver is normal without intra- or extra-hepatic biliary duct dilation. The gallbladder, spleen, pancreas and adrenal glands are normal. The kidneys excrete contrast promptly and symmetrically without hydronephrosis, mass or perinephric abnormality. The stomach and small bowel are normal in caliber without obstruction. In the right lower quadrant near the cecum is an inflammatory mass measuring approximately 3 x 3.1 cm. At the periphery of this focus, the appendix is equivocally visualized measuring approximately 1.1 cm. The cecum appears relatively normal. There is trace free fluid tracking down into the pelvis. There is no free air. There is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy. The urinary bladder, prostate, seminal vesicles and rectum are normal. There is no pelvic wall or inguinal lymphadenopathy. There are no worrisome blastic or lytic lesions.
